message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.DS, cs.MM

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper discusses the virtualization of network functions and the deployment of virtualized network functions (VNF) on standard virtualization platforms. It also talks about the coordination of VNF deployment across different geo-distributed data centers, which falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture. 
2. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper deals with the dynamic scaling of virtualized distributed service chains, which involves the coordination of multiple data centers. This falls under the scope of distributed, parallel, and cluster computing. 
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a system design for managing the dynamic deployment and scaling of VNF service chains. This falls under the scope of systems and control. 
4. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The paper discusses the proactive and reactive approaches used for timely, cost-effective scaling of service chains. This involves the use of algorithms and falls under the scope of data structures and algorithms. 
5. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper uses the case of an IMS, which is a subsystem for delivering multimedia services among mobile users, as an example to design a dynamic scaling system for geo-distributed VNF service chains. This falls under the scope of multimedia.
